alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 9:38PM CDT until May 06 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Hancock County in west central Illinois... Lee County in southeastern Iowa... Northern Clark County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 938 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Chambersburg, or 10 miles northwest of Kahoka, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Medill around 945 PM CDT. Kahoka, Croton, Revere, Battle of Athens Campground, Peaksville and Shimek State Forest around 950 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Donnellson, St. Francisville, Argyle, Vincennes, Lee County Fairgrounds, New Boston, Charleston, Wilson Lake, Montrose, Summitville, Keokuk Airport, Mooar, Chatfield Park, Keokuk, Nauvoo, Nauvoo State Park, Bluff Park, Galland, Sandusky, Camp Eastman, Niota, Ferris, Adrian, Colusa and Pontoosuc. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
